content.body: Adam Rice: all those isURL libraries do seem to do the equivalent of a hypothetical URL.canParse. Why do you expect that callers want something else? What would they want?
content.formatted_body: Adam Rice: all those isURL libraries do seem to do the equivalent of a hypothetical URL.canParse. Why do you expect that callers want something else? What would they want?

content.body: Thanks for checking. I thought they might want a validation that the input "looks" like a URL, eg. it only has one colon after the scheme, no punctuation in the hostname, no double-slashes in the path, stuff like that.
I don't know what to make of the fact that there are three different libraries that do the equivalent of `new URL` inside a try ... catch. I guess we need to "pave the cowpath" here.
content.formatted_body: I don't know what to make of the fact that there are three different libraries that do the equivalent of new URL inside a try ... catch. I guess we need to "pave the cowpath" here.

content.body: Adam Rice: some do offer additional things like isHTTPURL() (not sure how to case that properly), but that's on top
content.formatted_body: Adam Rice: some do offer additional things like isHTTPURL() (not sure how to case that properly), but that's on top

content.body: Noam Rosenthal: I need to do some thinking about https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/8143#issuecomment-1457636957 (particularly the "it's easy" bit...), but my first reaction is, what about audio and video?
content.formatted_body: Noam Rosenthal: I need to do some thinking about https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/8143#issuecomment-1457636957 (particularly the "it's easy" bit...), but my first reaction is, what about audio and video?

content.body: Eric Portis (he/him): yea, easier than with images, I'll reword.
content.formatted_body: Eric Portis (he/him): yea, easier than with images, I'll reword.

content.body: Eric Portis (he/him): you mean like CSS video backgrounds? Is that a thing? Video/Audio elements have a `crossorigin` attribute
content.formatted_body: Eric Portis (he/him): you mean like CSS video backgrounds? Is that a thing? Video/Audio elements have a crossorigin attribute
